content:
⚠️ Modified the Contribution.
Comment:
Mentioned in the input that the input integers are positive. As this is important for Shortest mode solutions that use RegEx.

Hum, already accepted. Yet the particular treatment of the last value in the odd case really is not great for reverse mode (it's not consistent with the other non-overlapping pairs as it reuses the first value).

probably better avg(triple)
4 6 8 10 => (4+6+8)/3 (6+8+10)/3
more variants of code: D[k..k+3].sum OR S.(add-next + substract-last) OR ...
upd:
or maybe quads better coz division by 3 is irrational

Took me just below a minute.  There may be a similar problem. 

I will approve it anyway, cause I don't remember seeing similar ones :D

I do not understand this statement. Can you give some example? When I  wrote my solution, then I followed the statement and computed the mean for odd case like this: (x[last]+0)/2 . It passed all the validators and tests.

Oh, my bad, I understood 0 as the first element (i.e. index 0)!
But anyway that does not make it better for reverse (you still have to guess, from very few examples, that you have to add 0 at the end in the odd case).

Mea Culpa! I did not notice that the Reverse mode is included. Well, it was my first CoC to approve, but anyway, I should have paid more attention to details. On the other hand, tests 2 and 5 should give great clue what to do with the odd case last element.
Tests 2 (size 5) and 4 (size 1) might be good enough indeed. Anyway people can give a feedback after each CoC so, if this one causes a problem, it should be noticed after some time I guess.
